name: Sheet Pan Cheeseburger Veggie Dinner with Garlic Mayo Dressing
description: This Sheet Pan Cheeseburger Veggie Dinner served with creamy homemade garlic mayo dressing will turn into a family favorite in no time! Deconstructed cheeseburger with wholesome plant based ingredients! GF
recipeIngredient: 7 oz firm tofu (pressed and cubed into 3/4 inch cubes)
1 15 oz can  chickpeas or lentils (drained. Or any other beans)
1  red bell pepper (chopped into 3/4 inch thick)
1/2 to 1 cup veggies of choice (such as broccoli, butternut squash, any seasonal veggies, etc)
2 tsp soy sauce ((use tamari for glutenfree))
1/3 cup cashew cream (which is 1/4 cup of cashews blended with 1/4 cup water, or use vegan Mayo )

recipeInstructions.text: Chop all of your veggies if you haven't already. Line or grease a large baking dish.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop all of your veggies if you haven't already. Line or grease a large baking dish.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 c)
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (205 c)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix in all of the cheeseburger sauce ingredients until well combined. Reserve 1 1/2 - 2 tbsp of this mixture to use later to drizzle on top.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix in all of the cheeseburger sauce ingredients until well combined. Reserve 1 1/2 - 2 tbsp of this mixture to use later to drizzle on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chopped veggies, and toss well to coat with the cheeseburger sauce mixture, until evenly coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chopped veggies, and toss well to coat with the cheeseburger sauce mixture, until evenly coated.

recipeInstructions.text: Drop this mixture into the prepared baking dish, and spread it out. You don't want the mixture to be thicker than double. I like to keep a single layer of the veggies and beans etc, it will give you the best result in terms of crispiness of the big veggies.
recipeInstructions.name: Drop this mixture into the prepared baking dish, and spread it out. You don't want the mixture to be thicker than double. I like to keep a single layer of the veggies and beans etc, it will give you the best result in terms of crispiness of the big veggies.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400 degrees F for 35-45 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender to preference, and everything else is starting to get gold and crisp. Sprinkle sunflower seeds on top in the last 5-10 mins of baking
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 400 degrees F for 35-45 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender to preference, and everything else is starting to get gold and crisp. Sprinkle sunflower seeds on top in the last 5-10 mins of baking

recipeInstructions.text: To make your Garlic Mayo Dressing: blend all the ingredients until well combined, taste and adjust flavor by adding more vinegar, salt, etc. You can also use already prepared non-dairy cream, or 1/4 cup vegan mayo instead.
recipeInstructions.name: To make your Garlic Mayo Dressing: blend all the ingredients until well combined, taste and adjust flavor by adding more vinegar, salt, etc. You can also use already prepared non-dairy cream, or 1/4 cup vegan mayo instead.

recipeInstructions.text: To serve, serve individual portions of the veggie tofu bean mixture, and drizzle the mayo on top. Thin out the reserved cheeseburger sauce with a tsp or two of water, and drizzle that as well.
recipeInstructions.name: To serve, serve individual portions of the veggie tofu bean mixture, and drizzle the mayo on top. Thin out the reserved cheeseburger sauce with a tsp or two of water, and drizzle that as well.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with some red pepper flakes, and fresh herbs of choice, and serve. You can also serve the tofu veggie mix over a bed of fresh lettuce!
recipeInstructions.name: Top with some red pepper flakes, and fresh herbs of choice, and serve. You can also serve the tofu veggie mix over a bed of fresh lettuce!

keywords: cheeseburger sheet pan dinner, sheet pan hamburger, vegan cheeseburger
